page.title: 05CHANGING TIMES
page.content: In an interview with Mr.J.A.Beswick, former headmaster of Bowdon C.E. Primary School,he was asked what changes had occurred during his 27 years in the area. When he first came to live in the area there were not as many houses as there are today.There are more houses because the owners of land sold it to builders.Then{Church Commission}land was open fields.{Gaddum Estate}was built on this land and fields which were fallow.They were also sold for private building in the village.A scheme for{IBM}to build a factory was defeated because of objections raised by residents.It is still fallow land. Bowdon is now twice the size as it was 28 years ago. Mr.Beswick said that many houses had been made into flats,such as the houses on the{"Firs".
